ratings.comment: I learned SO much in his class. I think everyone writing the bad reviews just didn't understand his teaching philosophy/didn't want to do the work required to get anything meaningful out of it. He is very intelligent and sometimes has a hard time communicating what he means. The class is easy, the textbook is fascinating. Recommend! HIGHLY!! :)

Professor Koranda was the absolute worst teacher I've ever had. He expects you to know everything and treats students as if we are grad students. He lectures at you instead of teaching you. He does NOT share his lecture slides and you CANNOT miss any classes or you will be lost and so far behind. Your entire grade is based on extremely hard exams.

He seems like a great guy and is funny and kind but his lectures are very all over the place and I have a hard time following along honestly. If you want to do well on exams, make sure you read the textbook and know everything on the study guide. Weekly assignments are easy but the exams are tough (multiple choice and essay questions)

I think Mark is the worst professor I have had while at UW. His lectures are so scattered, he often has to backtrack and rephrase his own ideas, and he contradicts the information in the textbook. Lectures are either exactly what the textbook say or completely unrelated. His exams are much more in depth than what was covered in lecture. DO NOT TAKE

He was clearly not prepared for the class (this was the first class he taught). He gave us the syllabus, even gave us a test on it, and then changed the assigned readings a million times just days before they were due. He is very self-absorbed, and goes on tangents during his lectures. His introduction video was the weirdest thing I've ever seen.

Hands down the worst lecturer I have ever had. His slides have maybe three words and them and he is all over the place when speaking. Lots of reading that you have to do in order to understand anything. Take any other psych course as this focuses more on things like linguistic than actual psychology.

Do not take this class. His lectures are so vague and hard to follow, and I usually had no idea what he was talking about. There is about 50 pages of reading a week, which you have to do and take notes on because the majority of test questions come from the textbook.

Lectures could be a little confusing at time but he was a really engaging professor! Good communication from him and the TA. Lots of outside reading from the lectures but the material is interesting. Overall good class and professor.

Dr. K was nice and passionate about the material, but the lectures did not help at all. There is a lot of reading, but the readings are helpful for the exams. Only graded on 4 exams, one homework assignment, and participation. If you do the reading, it's an easy A. Lots of extra credit options, especially towards the end of the semester.

Lectures were not helpful at all. If you read the book, you're pretty good for the exams. There are no quizzes, just 4 exams and the final is cumulative. There were tons of opportunities for extra credit towards the end. Dr. K was not the best lecturer, he tended to go off on tangents and the whole class would be lost. The book was sooo helpful.
Mark was a great professor! His lectures were a little hard to follow along with but overall an interesting class. Him and his TA were on top of things and communicated very well. Would recommend!

Not sure if it was because this class was online but I did not enjoy the lectures. The overall concept of the class is interesting and the textbook makes sense, but the lectures are no help. They made zero sense to me and I basically taught myself. Lots of reading but no homework besides that.

Prof Koranda is great!! He's really funny and engaging. The class itself is very interesting, and he does a great job of making lectures fun and interesting. Kind of reading heavy, but the readings aren't too bad because they're usually interesting. The tests are very fair; you will do well if you do the readings. Highly recommend!!
